title: Haunted House
text:
This is my solution to the R/Python User Group coding challenge for the Halloween Haunted House.
I really just used this as an excuse to learn how to use and make Quarto extensions, if I’m being honest.

title: Haunted House
text:
Enter the haunted house
Think you’re brave enough to enter the haunted house? Before you can get in, you’ll need to solve the riddle below…
If you get it right, you’ll be able to enter (if you dare). But beware, this haunted house is not too forgiving to trespassers who have no business being here…

title: Haunted House
text:
Instructions:

Solve the riddle on the page.
When you think you know the answer, modify the code below with your guess.
Click on “Run code”.
Click on one of the two pug buttons, based on the output from the code cell.
If your guess was correct, you’ll be told the correct pug to click on. If your answer was incorrect, you’ll be misled…

Riddle: What month does Halloween take place in?

Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.

title: You’ve entered Room 2
text:
You made it into Room 2. Congratulations!…I guess.
For all that hard work, you’ve won yourself a prize: 4 more riddles to solve!
Riddle to enter Room 2: The Other Mother offered me a chance to stay in the Other World forever, if only buttons can be sewn into my eyes.

Ideas “Scariest” page by making it really ugly and ridiculous:

Music that you can’t turn off
Really ugly animation
Really ugly CSS (including comic sans and ugly colours)

title: You’ve entered Room 4
text:

For all that hard work, you’ve won yourself a prize: 2 more riddles to solve!
Riddle to enter Room 5: I’m Jack Skellington’s enemy, and I wear a burlap sack.
